questions.prompt: 1. In BG 12.1, Arjuna asks which is better—worshiping Krishna personally or worshiping the impersonal Brahman?
choices: Those engaged in loving service to Krishna's personal form
questions.feedback: Krishna favors personal devotion over impersonal realization of Brahman.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 12.2, what is the nature of those who worship Krishna?
choices: Well-versed in scriptures, steadfast, devoted, and dear to Krishna
questions.feedback: Those devoted to Krishna's personal worship are particularly beloved by Him.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 12.4-5, what is more difficult—meditating on the impersonal or on Krishna personally?
choices: Impersonal meditation is more difficult; thinking of Krishna is simpler
questions.feedback: Meditation on the impersonal, formless Brahman is more difficult and painful for most people.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 12.6, what is the result for those who dedicate all activities to Krishna?
choices: I quickly redeem them from the ocean of birth and death
questions.feedback: Krishna takes full responsibility for those who surrender all their actions to Him.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 12.7, what is the time span for those engaged in Krishna's service?
choices: Very soon; those who constantly engage in My service attain Me quickly
questions.feedback: Sincere devotees who engage exclusively in Krishna's service attain Him very quickly.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 12.8, what should one do if unable to concentrate on Krishna?
choices: Engage in yoga practice to reach Krishna's consciousness
questions.feedback: Even if one cannot directly meditate, performing yoga practices helps develop Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 12.9, what is the next step for those unable to practice yoga?
choices: Engage in the cultivation of knowledge and work for that purpose
questions.feedback: For those unable to practice yoga directly, cultivating knowledge and working with that understanding helps.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 12.10, what is the simplest practice according to Krishna?
choices: Just work for Me and surrender the results to Me
questions.feedback: The simplest path is to work without attachment and surrender all results to Krishna.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 12.13-14, what are the qualities of someone dear to Krishna?
choices: Free from hatred, envious, peaceful, affectionate, and always engaged in Krishna's service
questions.feedback: Those who are peaceful, non-violent, affectionate, and devoted are particularly dear to Krishna.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 12.15, what should one avoid?
choices: Disturbing the mind of others or being envious
questions.feedback: One should not create disturbance in others or cultivate envy and jealousy.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 12.16, what are people dear to Krishna particularly careful about?
choices: Always engaging in Krishna consciousness; keeping their minds always fixed on Krishna
questions.feedback: Those dear to Krishna are always careful to remain absorbed in Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 12.17, what does Krishna assure about His devotees?
choices: I am never averse to them; they are dear to Me
questions.feedback: Krishna assures that He is never displeased with those engaged in His devotional service.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 12.18, whom does Krishna consider equally worthy of love?
choices: The humble, the friendly, the merciful, and those who are not territorial
questions.feedback: Krishna loves the humble, friendly, merciful, and selfless souls equally.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 12.19, what is said about the spiritual master?
choices: One should take shelter of a spiritual master; they are very dear to Krishna
questions.feedback: The spiritual master is very dear to Krishna when they help others attain Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 12.20, what is the path to Krishna that is described as imperishable?
choices: The transcendental path of devotional service is imperishable and supreme
questions.feedback: The transcendental path of devotional love is eternal, unchanging, and the supreme goal.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 12.6-7 (from purport), what is the guarantee Krishna gives?
choices: Whoever engages fully in Krishna's service will reach Him very quickly
questions.feedback: Krishna assures swift liberation for those who exclusively serve Him with full faith.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 12.8-10 (from purport), what is the progressive path for those unable to meditate?
choices: Yoga practice, then knowledge, then surrender of results
questions.feedback: There are steps for those unable to directly meditate: yoga, knowledge, then surrender.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 12.13-19 (from purport), what is the profile of a true devotee?
choices: Selfless, non-violent, compassionate, and constantly engaged in Krishna's service
questions.feedback: A true devotee displays qualities of love, compassion, humility, and constant service.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 12.2 (from purport), why are Krishna's personal devotees superior to impersonal realization seekers?
choices: Because personal devotion leads to love of Krishna and direct relationship with Him
questions.feedback: Personal devotion to Krishna is superior because it establishes eternal loving relationship.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 12.1 (from purport), why should one worship Krishna?
choices: Because Krishna is the ultimate goal and source of all happiness
questions.feedback: One should worship Krishna because He is the absolute truth and source of all joy.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 12.11 (from purport), what is the importance of performing one's duties?
choices: Even simple duties, when performed for Krishna, purify the heart
questions.feedback: Any work, when done as service to Krishna, becomes purifying and leads to spirituality.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 12.10 (from purport), what makes Krishna's yoga accessible?
choices: It can be practiced by anyone; it is easy and practical
questions.feedback: Krishna's yoga is accessible to all regardless of qualification; it is simple and effective.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 12.15 (from purport), why should one avoid creating disturbance?
choices: Because it affects others' spiritual progress and creates bad karma
questions.feedback: Disturbing others creates karmic reactions and blocks one's own spiritual progress.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 12.18 (from purport), what is special about Krishna's love for the humble?
choices: He shows special affection to the humble and compassionate
questions.feedback: Krishna's love overflows toward the humble, gentle, and compassionate souls.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 12 (summary), what is the main teaching?
choices: Loving devotion to Krishna is the highest path; it is accessible to all and guaranteed to lead to Him
questions.feedback: Chapter 12 establishes that loving devotion to Krishna is supreme, practical, and universally accessible.
